groups.name: Content
groups.description: Requirements related to the substantive content of the articles.

requirements.description: An article should start with a clear definition in the lead section.
requirements.reference: The first sentence of the lead should define what the scope of the article is.

requirements.description: The lead section should summarize the most important aspects of the article.
requirements.reference: The lead should summarize the most important aspects of the article.

requirements.description: Include a section on the gene's function.
requirements.reference: A section on the gene's function should be included.

requirements.description: Include a section on the gene's clinical significance.
requirements.reference: A section on the gene's clinical significance should be included.

requirements.description: Include a section on the gene's interactions.
requirements.reference: A section on the gene's interactions should be included.
requirements.when: Applicable if interaction data is available.

groups.name: Formatting
groups.description: Requirements related to the formatting of the articles.

requirements.description: Use the infobox template for gene articles.
requirements.reference: The infobox template should be used for gene articles.

requirements.description: Use the infobox template for protein articles.
requirements.reference: The infobox template should be used for protein articles.

requirements.description: Ensure consistent use of headings and subheadings.
requirements.reference: Headings and subheadings should be used consistently.

groups.name: Language Usage
groups.description: Guidelines for the appropriate use of language, including gene nomenclature and abbreviations.

requirements.description: Human gene names should be written in all capitals.
requirements.reference: Human gene names are written in capitals, for example ALDOA, INS, etc.

requirements.description: Protein names should be written in sentence case.
requirements.reference: Protein names are written in sentence case, for example insulin, hemoglobin, etc.

requirements.description: Avoid using jargon and technical terms without explanation.
requirements.reference: Avoid jargon and technical terms without explanation.

groups.name: Citations
groups.description: Requirements related to the citation of sources within the articles.

requirements.description: Cite reliable sources for all statements.
requirements.reference: All statements should be supported by reliable sources.

requirements.description: Use inline citations for specific claims.
requirements.reference: Inline citations should be used for specific claims.

requirements.description: Include a references section at the end of the article.
requirements.reference: A references section should be included at the end of the article.

groups.name: Structure
groups.description: Requirements related to the structural organization of the articles.

requirements.description: Follow a standard structure for gene articles.
requirements.reference: Gene articles should follow a standard structure.

requirements.description: Follow a standard structure for protein articles.
requirements.reference: Protein articles should follow a standard structure.

requirements.description: Include a 'See also' section if relevant.
requirements.reference: A 'See also' section should be included if relevant.
requirements.when: Applicable if there are related topics.
